WoS Advanced: NEAR/0 - the string must be fromatted with field codes, e.g. TI=(term NEAR/0 term)
ProQuest Health and Medical:
PRE/n - look for documents that contain one search term that appears within a specified number of words before a second term.

Replace ‘n’ with a number, e.g nursing PRE/4 education

In the example, 4 means the first term precedes the second term by 4 or fewer words.

WoS Advanced: $ - this is for 0 or 1 character, polyglot translates to a * which if for a group of characters or 0 characters

Publisher name, for NCBI BookShelf citations

Includes chemical, protocol, disease or organism terms

Includes all words and numbers in the title, abstract, other abstract, MeSH terms, MeSH Subheadings, Publication Types, Substance Names, Personal Name as Subject, Corporate Author, Secondary Source, Comment/Correction Notes, and Other Terms (see Other Term [OT] above) typically non-MeSH subject terms (keywords)
